title: A man purchases 10 cows at Rs. 3000 each. 1 cow died. He sold 2 cows at 5% loss, at what rate he should sell the remaining cows, so as to gain a profit of 10 % on the total cost? - Quora

response.answer_text: The man spent 10*3000 = Rs.30,000 in buying 10 cows. 1 cow died. He sold 2 cows at 5% loss that he sold the 2 cows at Rs.2850 each or Rs.5700 for the two cows.. To make a profit of 10% on the total cost, the total SP should be 30000*110/100 = Rs.33,000. He recovers Rs.5700 from the sale of two cows. So he has to recover (33,000–5,700) = Rs.27,300 from the sale the remaining 10–1–2 = 7 cows. So he must sell the 7 cows at (27300/7) = Rs.3900, each. Answer.

CP of 10 cows= 30000 SP of 9 cows should be 33000/ -which means Rs.3000/- profit overall. 2 cows were sold at a loss of 5%. CP of 2 cows 6000/- hence loss = 300/- SP being 5700/- 1 cow died so loss of 3000/- So total loss Rs.3300/- Balance required: 33000 -5700=27300/- Hence the remaining 7 cows should be sold for Rs.28300/- i.e. at Rs.3900/-- each
